result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melissa M. Erdman not in court.  Attorney Gene A Cisewski appeared by phone for Melissa M. Erdman.  Attorney Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney states that Defendant is in ATR and requests an adjournment. Court adjourns.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on January 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Melissa M. Erdman
Current: 101 Hart Lane, Elroy, WI 53929 United States  (Effective: 10-18-2022)
Prior: 509 South Water Street #121, Sparta, WI 54656
Letter dated 10/13/22 from Clerk to Lt Hallman

The Court orders a bond modification for the Defendant Melissa M Erdman to change her bond from $250 cash to $25,000 signature bond. This change is only to take effect upon the Department of Corrections arranging transportation for the defendant to the treatment facility. Upon completion of said treatment, whether through successful graduation or any other reason, Defendant shall return to the Monroe County Jail, and the original $250 cash bond with original conditions shall be reinstated.
